programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Southern (21-14) defeated UC San Diego, 68-56, in the First Four behind 24 points from Soniyah Reed; UCLA (30-2) earned its first No. 1 seed in program history after securing its first 30-win season with a Big Ten Tournament title.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: USF (23-10) earned its ninth berth in the last 12 possible seasons after winning the AAC Tournament behind MVP Carla Brito; Tennessee (22-9) makes its 43rd-straight appearance, the only team to play in every year of the tournament.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Norfolk State (30-4) enters on a 19-game winning streak after winning the MEAC Tournament to secure its first 30-win season in program history; Maryland (23-7) makes its 14th-straight appearance, tied for the fourth longest active streak.

programme.title: College Wrestling
programme.desc: Championship round of the DI Men's Wrestling Championships at the Wells Fargo Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania after the semi-finals round on March 21; Penn State won the 2024 edition of the tournament ahead of second-place Cornell with a 172.5.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Vermont (21-12) earned its second berth in the last three years after winning the America East Tournament behind Nikola Priede; NC State (26-6) makes its eighth-straight appearance, and will look to build upon its trip to the Final Four last year.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Murray State (25-7) earned its first berth since 2008 after winning the Missouri Valley Tournament behind MVP Katelyn Young; Iowa (22-10) makes its seventh-straight appearance, advancing to the national title game the last two years.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Detroit opened its four-game road trip with a 4-1 loss at Washington, and the Red Wings won their last encounter with the Golden Knights, 3-0, on March 16; Vegas improved its home record to 25-7-3 with a 5-1 victory over Boston.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.desc: The worldwide leader in sports covers all the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Mississippi State (21-11) earned its second berth in the first three seasons under Sam Purcell; Cal (25-8) makes its first appearance since 2019 in its first season as a member of the ACC, and face the Bulldogs for the first time.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: College Wrestling
programme.desc: Semifinals round of the DI Men's Wrestling Championships at the Wells Fargo Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania after the first three sessions; Penn State claimed the 2024 edition of the tournament ahead of second-place Cornell with a 172.5 score.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: South Dakota State (29-3) earned its 13th berth in the last 16 possible seasons after winning the Summit League Tournament behind Paige Mayer; Oklahoma State (25-6) makes its second appearance in the first three seasons under Jacie Hoyt.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Green Bay (29-5) enters on a 22-game win streak after claiming the Horizon League Tournament in its first season under Kayla Karius; Alabama (23-8) makes its fourth appearance in the last five seasons after a tournament drought dating back to 1999.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: The top collegiate hip hop dancing squads from across the country compete for the UDA national title, showcasing their skills and choreography to a panel of judges at the annual event who grade their performances under certain criteria.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: George Mason (27-5) earned its first berth in program history after winning the Atlantic 10 Tournament behind Zahirah Walton; Florida State (23-8) makes its 12th-straight appearance behind Ta'Niya Latson, who led the country in scoring with 24.9 ppg.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Dayton (23-10) held on to beat Florida Atlantic, 86-79, behind 30 points from Javon Bennett; Chattanooga (25-9) went to triple overtime to beat Middle Tennessee, 109-103, behind 31 points from Bash Wieland and 27 points from Trey Bonham.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at college basketball games around the country, as they review highlights of some of the top moments, profile the top players, analyze the strengths and weaknesses of competing teams, and more.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Dave Gavitt, a former basketball coach at Providence, was the driving force behind the creation of the Big East Conference in 1979, which flourished in the 1980s and became one of the most highly respected basketball conferences in the country.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Renowned fishing champion Jimmy Houston travels around the world fishing for largemouth bass, crappie and other fish, and he demonstrates his hunting techniques with other athletes, celebrities and friends who love to fish.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Directors Lisa Lax, Hannah Storm and Nancy Winters take an in-depth look at the fierce rivalry between Chris Evert and Martina Navratilova, two tennis players who would face each other on the court 80 times and forge a lasting friendship.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: F1 drivers aim for the best starting spot in the Chinese Grand Prix, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Lando Norris gained an early seven-point lead over Max Verstappen after winning the opener at Australia.

programme.title: Fab Five
programme.desc: Jalen Rose, Juwan Howard, Jimmy King, Ray Jackson and coaches discuss their time at the University of Michigan, reliving the recruitment process that brought the Fab Five together in 1991 and their two appearances in the NCAA Championship Game.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: The latest news and updates surrounding the fighters competing in the upcoming UFC event are featured, breaking down the fight card with in-depth analysis of the premier matches highlighting the event, along with profiles of the combatants.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: Orlando and Gotham split wins in two meetings from 2024, with Gotham claiming a 3-1 victory in the final matchup on Oct. 20; Sam Hiatt and Rose Lavelle scored in the first half of the win while Ella Stevens added the third in the second half.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Oklahoma State (16-17) defeated Wichita State, 89-79, to advance behind 23 points from Bryce Thompson and 13 from Abou Ousmane; SMU (24-10) beat Northern Iowa, 73-63, behind 16 points and 10 rebounds and seven assists from B.J. Edwards.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Analysts preview the Chinese Grand Prix and Lando Norris, who gained the early seven-point lead after winning at Australia, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: SEC Inside
programme.desc: SEC teams prepare for their upcoming opponent with practice sessions and work inside the film room, featuring coaches drilling their players and offering advice, an exclusive look at how the schools game plan, and exclusive talks with team members.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Loyola (23-11) held on to defeat San Jose State, 73-70, to advance behind 24 points from Des Watson and 14 from Miles Rubin; San Franciso (25-9) beat Utah Valley, 79-70, and beat the Ramblers, 76-66, on Dec. 15 behind 35 points from Malik Thomas.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: William & Mary (16-18) defeated High Point, 69-63, in the First Four behind 24 points from Bella Nascimento; Texas (32-3) makes its 11th-straight appearance, and earned back-to-back No. 1 seeds for the first time since four from 1985 to 1988.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: From 1990-1993, the Buffalo Bills were known as much for their talent as their fighting in the locker room, but the team managed to come together to make a series of memorable Super Bowl runs that all ended in disappointment.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.desc: In 1983, North Carolina State suffered 10 losses in the regular season and had to overcome national powerhouses to win the ACC Tournament and qualify for the NCAA Tournament, where the Wolfpack mounted a memorable run to the national championship.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Kent State (23-11) blew out St. Bonaventure, 75-56, behind 14 points from VonCameron Davis and a Delrecco Gilespie double-double; Stanford (21-13) defeated Cal State Northridge, 87-70, behind 22 points from Maxime Raynaud and 20 from Oziyah Sellers.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: UCLA, USC, defending champion South Carolina and Texas are the No. 1 seeds in their respective regional brackets, as 68 teams battle it out in the single-elimination tournament to crown a national champion in women's college basketball.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: The latest news and reports surrounding the X Games and athlete-focused content is featured, including profiles of the top athletes and artists, previews of the biggest events, special documentaries, and recaps of major events.

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: The latest news and reports surrounding the X Games and athlete-focused content is featured, including profiles of the top athletes and artists, previews of the biggest events, special documentaries, and recaps of major events.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Nebraska (9-11, 1-5) defeated Pepperdine, 11-4, on March 19; USC (12-8, 2-4) is 2-2 all-time against the Cornhuskers after earning a 4-3 victory on Feb. 17, 2013, as Adam Landecker had a game-winning walk off hit in the bottom of the ninth inning.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim secured his second win in the first three races of the season with his victory at Las Vegas over Grant Enfinger, while defending champion Ty Majeski leads the standings; Enfinger averaged 119.15 mph to win the race last year.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: Poland is unbeaten in the past three encounters against Lithuania after earning a 4-0 triumph at Stadion Narodowy in an international friendly matchup on June 12, 2018, as Robert Lewandowski notched a brace in the first half.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the race in California; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the race in California; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: North Macedonia, which has won its past five contests across all competitions, is 10-1-0 all-time Liechtenstein after earning a 4-0 victory at Rheinpark Stadion in a World Cup qualifier on Oct. 8, 2021, as Darko Velkovski scored and added an assist.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Omaha claimed victories over Indy in their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on March 13 with a 3-2 scoreline; Brooke Nuneviller posted 17 kills and a pair of blocks for the Supernovas in the win.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifying
programme.desc: Drivers aim for the best starting position for the upcoming race in California, and the fastest time is awarded pole position; Felix Rosenqvist averaged 107.317 mph last year to win the pole at Thermal, but would finish the race in ninth.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
